intro: Melilotus expansus, commonly known as broadleaf melilot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, branching clusters called panicles. Its leaves are compound, with several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Melilotus expansus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
